733240f-a.title: Squatters Colony [Hooverville] on Hester Street.
733240f-a.text:
Shacks of the unemployed on Hester Street, between Chrystie and Forsyth
Streets. These structures were built from donations by the Down Town Store
Fixtures Association. During the period of Hoover's presidency these squatter
colonies were colloquially known as "Hooverville".
January 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

718815f-a.text:
Chrystie Street, west side, north from Hester Street. This view shows the site of Roosevelt Park, it also shows Forsyth Street, east side,
north from but not including Hester Street.
July 18, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
